translations.text: The Merciful One
has taught the Qur'an,<sup foot_note="181777">1</sup>
has created man,<sup foot_note="181778">1</sup>
and has taught him articulate speech.<sup foot_note="181779">1</sup>
The sun and the moon follow a reckoning,<sup foot_note="181780">1</sup>
and the stars<sup foot_note="181781">1</sup> and the trees all prostrate themselves,<sup foot_note="181782">2</sup>
and He has raised up the heaven and has set a balance<sup foot_note="181783">1</sup>
that you may not transgress in the balance,
but weigh things equitably and skimp not in the balance.<sup foot_note="181784">1</sup>
And He<sup foot_note="181785">1</sup> has set up the earth for all beings.<sup foot_note="181786">2</sup>
Therein are fruit and palm-trees with their dates in sheaths,
and a variety of corn with both husk and grain.<sup foot_note="181787">1</sup>
Which of the bounties of your Lord<sup foot_note="181788">1</sup> will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181789">2</sup>
He has created man from dry, rotten clay like the potter's,<sup foot_note="181790">1</sup>
and has created the jinn from the flame of fire.<sup foot_note="181791">1</sup>
Which of the wonders of your Lord's power<sup foot_note="181792">1</sup> will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Lord of the two easts and of the two wests is He.<sup foot_note="181793">1</sup>
Which of the powers of your Lord<sup foot_note="181794">1</sup> will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
He unleashed the two seas so that they merge together,
and yet there is a barrier between them which they may not overstep.<sup foot_note="181795">1</sup>
Which of the wonders of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
From these seas come forth pearls<sup foot_note="181796">1</sup> and coral.<sup foot_note="181797">2</sup>
Which of the wonders of your Lord's power will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181798">1</sup>
His are the ships,<sup foot_note="181799">1</sup> towering on the sea like mountains.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181800">1</sup>
All<sup foot_note="181801">1</sup> that is on earth will perish,
only the Person of your Lord, full of majesty and splendour, will endure.
So which of the wonders of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181802">1</sup>
All in the heavens and the earth entreat Him for their needs; a new, mighty task engages Him each day.<sup foot_note="181803">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's laudable attributes will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181804">1</sup>
O you twain, who are a burden (on the earth),<sup foot_note="181805">1</sup> We shall attend to you and call you to account.<sup foot_note="181806">2</sup>
(We shall then see), which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181807">1</sup>

O company of jinn and men, if you have the power to go beyond the bounds of the heavens and the earth, go beyond them! Yet you will be unable to go beyond them for that requires infinite power.<sup foot_note="181808">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
(If you so venture) a flame of fire and smoke<sup foot_note="181809">1</sup> shall be lashed at you, which you shall be unable to withstand.
Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
(What will happen) when the heaven will be split asunder and will become crimson like leather?<sup foot_note="181810">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181811">1</sup>
On that Day there will be no need to ask either men or jinn about their sins.<sup foot_note="181812">1</sup>
(We shall see) which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181813">1</sup>
The culprits shall be known by their marks, and shall be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
Which of the powers of your Lord, will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
(It will be said): “This is the Hell that the culprits had cried lies to.
They will keep circling around between Hell and boiling water.<sup foot_note="181814">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181815">1</sup>
For any who fears to stand before his Lord<sup foot_note="181816">1</sup> are two Gardens.<sup foot_note="181817">2</sup>
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181818">1</sup>
These Gardens will abound in green, blooming branches.
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In each of the two Gardens are two flowing springs.
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In both these is a pair of every fruit.<sup foot_note="181819">1</sup>
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
They shall recline on couches lined with brocade,<sup foot_note="181820">1</sup> and within reach shall hang the fruits of the two Gardens.
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In the midst of these shall be maidens with modest, restrained glances;<sup foot_note="181821">1</sup> maidens whom no man or jinn has ever touched before.<sup foot_note="181822">2</sup>
Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Lovely as rubies and pearls.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Can the reward of goodness be any other than goodness?<sup foot_note="181823">1</sup>
Which of the laudable attributes of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?<sup foot_note="181824">1</sup>
And besides these two there shall be two other Gardens.<sup foot_note="181825">1</sup>
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Two Gardens, dark green and fresh.<sup foot_note="181826">1</sup>
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In them will be two gushing springs.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Therein will be fruits and dates and pomegranates.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
In the midst of these will be maidens, good and comely.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
There shall be maidens sheltered in tents.<sup foot_note="181827">1</sup>
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
No man or jinn ever touched them before.
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
They shall be reclining on green cushions and splendid carpets.<sup foot_note="181828">1</sup>
Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?
Blessed be the name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Glory.
